events.description: Japan's bank lending rose 4.5% year-on-year in January 2026, marking the fastest pace since April 2021.

facts.fact_text: Japan's bank lending rose 4.5% year-on-year in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Japan’s bank lending rose 4.5% year-on-year in January 2026, up from a 4.4% gain in December and in line with market expectations, marking the fastest pace since April 2021.

facts.fact_text: Total outstanding loans across major, regional, and shinkin banks reached ¥663.8 trillion.

evidences.evidence_text: Total outstanding loans across major, regional, and shinkin banks reached ¥663.8 trillion.

facts.fact_text: Major banks saw a 5.8% increase in lending, while regional banks saw a 4.1% increase.

evidences.evidence_text: Major banks led the expansion with a 5.8% increase, followed by regional banks at 4.1%.

claims.claim_text: The modest rise in Shinkin bank lending reflects softer credit demand in certain parts of the economy.

evidences.evidence_text: Shinkin banks, local cooperative lenders serving small businesses and communities, saw a more modest 1.4% rise, reflecting softer credit demand in parts of the economy.

evidence.evidence_text: Japan Bank Lending Growth Hits Near 5-Year High
reflecting softer credit demand in parts of the economy.
